intro: Gongrothamnus angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan thornbush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are typically clustered in terminal umbels. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. Gongrothamnus angolensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
